definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
to break out into a cold sweat (idiom)

sentences.english: Helen was in a cold sweat from fear when she sighted the corpse.
sentences.chinese: 海伦看到尸体，吓出了一身冷汗。

sentences.english: He Xiachu a cold sweat, and quickly bow Dajian, the targeting of tiger shooting.
sentences.chinese: 他吓出一身冷汗，赶紧拉弓搭箭，对准老虎就射。

sentences.english: Raul made Canizares break into a sweat with a shot to the post;
sentences.chinese: 劳尔的射门让卡尼萨雷斯惊出了一身冷汗。

sentences.english: Mainly because of the sweat buildup.
sentences.chinese: 主要是因为他们正在不停的出冷汗。

sentences.english: Too hung, locust tree really surprised out in a cold sweat, thanks to the file didnt hand over to.
sentences.chinese: 太悬了，槐树着实惊出一身冷汗，多亏文件没交出去。

sentences.english: I became dizzy, broke into a cold sweat and nearly threw up.
sentences.chinese: 我感到头晕，浑身出冷汗并差点呕吐出来。

sentences.english: She grasps the right hand of dried fish to keep emitting cold sweat.
sentences.chinese: 她抓着鱼干的右手不停地冒冷汗。

sentences.english: Wu suspects gave police the statement of the cold body.
sentences.chinese: 嫌疑人吴某的供述还让民警出了身冷汗。

sentences.english: The pen no longer had magic. I was  frightened into cold sweat.
sentences.chinese: 魔笔不再有魔力了，我被吓出了一身冷汗。

sentences.english: Cold sweat bedewed Mr. Lin's forehead. He was frantic.
sentences.chinese: 可是林先生却急坏了，冷汗从额角上钻出来。

sentences.english: The thought made me break out in perspiration (cold).
sentences.chinese: 每当我想起这个菜名就会出一身冷汗。

sentences.english: When you’re phone bill comes… Ka-Ching!
sentences.chinese: 收到电话账单时会让你惊出一身冷汗。

sentences.english: Waking in a cold sweat, Medivh makes his way to the bedchamber of his father.
sentences.chinese: 麦迪文浑身冒着冷汗醒来，走向父亲的卧室。

sentences.english: Lots of cold sweat will come out from our bodies after a nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 我们有时做恶梦醒来后全身出冷汗。

sentences.english: Shasta noticed that he was trembling and sweating all over.
sentences.chinese: 沙斯塔注意到他自己浑身发抖，全身都在冒冷汗。

sentences.english: Every time I look at the picture, though, my palms still get a little sweaty.
sentences.chinese: 不过每次我看到这张照片，我手掌心都还是会冒冷汗。

definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
lingering fear/fear after the event/post-traumatic stress
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
variant of 冷戰|冷战[leng3 zhan5]
